name: Drury Inn & Suites - New Orleans

reviews.text: We had a group of 10 (5 rooms) in town for a football game. I selected this property based on the TA reviews, location, and price. We were not disappointed. The hotel delivers excellent value. Rooms were clean and some of them were roomy (others weren't) - ask for the 04 stack of you are renting a king. Breakfast was fine - waffles, sausage, eggs, breads, muffins, bagels, cereals, juice, coffee. Evening snacks/drinks were really not needed given the city we were in and all the awesome dining options but I would think if you had kids with you and they were old enough to leave in the room for a few hours you would be thrilled with the oportunity to feed them chicken nuggets or hot dogs and then go out for a great meal. The drinks were either draft bud light or house wine/whiskey - 3 per person. Service was excellent all around - front desk, housekeeping and others. Rooftop jacuzzi was a nice addition. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Excellent value!

reviews.text: We were very satisfied with our accommodations here. Located just 2 blocks from the French Quarter and right on the trolley line. Room was HUGE, 2-room suite, 2 TVS, large bath, beautiful lobby. No complaints. Bring your walking shoes because you are several blocks from the convention center (takes about 20 minutes) but everyone is walking and you can state you stayed 'in style' without paying outrageous prices. We based our selection on Trip Advisor recommendations and they were right on AGAIN! Thanx Trip Advisor for a good experience.
reviews.title: We got lucky. Satisfied and then some...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I picked this hotel for three reasons: the TripAdvisor rating, the pictures, and all the freebies. It has lived up to all 3. Very good hotel to stay at. You will not be hungry given all the free food. You will not go without internet. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Close Enough to the Action, Much Nicer Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot of other New Orleans hotels like to describe themselves as "historical". Don't fall for it. "Historical" is a euphemism for "we cheaped out and haven't updated this place in decades". Stay at the Drury Hotel instead and enjoy the modern, comfortable, and reasonably-priced accomodations.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights after a 15 day cruise. The rooms are huge, very clean and an excellent bathroom. It is about 3 blocks from the French Quarter. They provided a nice what they call evening snack but it was enough to be our dinner for the first night. It is everything that you see on the website. Breakfast was also very good and included. The staff was very friendly and courteous. It can be a little noisy early evening with traffic.
reviews.title: Loved everything about this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I first stayed at a Drury Inn early this year and was pleasantly surprised, so I was glad to see one for our vacation to New Orleans. For the price I wasn't expecting much but the reviews were very good and was happy to see that the hotel is easy to get to from the interstate, close to great dining and in a quite (business district) area but 4 blocks from the French quarter. I love this hotel!
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.text: This was my second stay in this hotel. The first was before Hurricane Katrina and the 2nd was after in 2010. We remembered having a very nice stay there before so decided to try this hotel again. The location is wonderful...right next to the trolley line (but not a noice issue...very quite). The price is very reasonable. We checked around...an excellent value in my opinion. We got a 2 room King Suite for the 3 of us. We loved everything about this room. The ceilings and windows are old-style tall...which just feels right in this city. There is lots of granite everywhere. The living room is a completely separate room so everyone had their privacy. The king bed was very comfortable. My 17 year old son said the fold out couch was pretty nice too....although he wouldn't want to share it with anyone...then again, he's 6'4 and about 210 lbs.! The breakfast was a very nice buffet, hot, and plentiful with real scrambled eggs, biscuits, bacon, fruit, juice...and the evening cocktails/soda and wings, chips, baked potatoes, hotdogs, veggies, dips, & chicken fingers were plentiful and a great alternative to eating out again. We had a big lunch so just "snack food" was perfect allowing us time to enjoy the pool on the ROOF!! Parking is fenced, selfpark right next to the hotel for about $17. It is within easy walking distance of the famous "Mother's"...and all the traditional New Orleans favorites. When you consider the price of breakfast and the free alcoholic beverages and snacks...it is so worth the price....I think with parking included we paid about $150 tops. I am ready to go there again!
reviews.title: I love this hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many good reviews for this hotel but I just had to add one more! The staff was top notch and very friendly. The location is great - just several blocks from the Quarter which is an easy walk. We took advantage of the happy hour only of the two days we were there but it was a real bonus. The self parking in the gated lot was convenient and a real plus since so many hotels have valet parking only. We have been to New Orleans about six times previously but this was our first time staying here. This will be our first choice of hotels when we return!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.text: From the moment we entered the hotel reception ( which is beautiful) we were made to feel very welcome.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY

reviews.text: My wife , and my two kids ( 11 &9) had a one bedroom suite which was very clean, comfortable, had a jacuzi bathtub, free wireless and a huge flat screen TV in both rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had absolutely no complaints with this hotel. Stayed here pre cruise. Previous reviews have been right on. What a comfy bed and soft linens. We felt as if we were staying in a 5 star hotel. Our king room was spacious with a large TV with cable channels. The personnel were so accommodating especially when they found us a deluxe room when we showed up post cruise with no reservation after our flight had been canceled. And this was during a Saints football weekend. The value of this hotel is outstanding.
reviews.title: My first choice in NOLA

reviews.text: This hotel is on Poydras Street, which is about a 7 min walk from the French Quarter. It is a safe area, and the advantage of its location vs staying within the Quarter is that it is quiet at night and closer to the Superdome and basketball arena, Riverwalk area, and the excellent National WWII Museum. It is also very close to a really good diner called Mothers if you don't want to walk to the Quarter for a meal.
reviews.title: Great value; no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers large, clean rooms, complementary breakfast, free drinks and coffee, free dinner (they call it a snack, but with hot dogs, fried chicken, meatballs, vegetables and cocktails, I call it a buffet dinner), and friendly, helpful service.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Only drawbacks are the somewhat insipid breakfast, and the old building and rooms (which admittedly is part of the charm).
reviews.title: What a disappointment! Steer clear of Room 222

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.text: We stayed here based on TA reviews. Everything was right on. They had nice rooms, a rooftop pool with great views, free drinks and snacks in the PM, and breakfast buffet. We were able to walk to the French Quarter with no problems. The streetcar goes up and down St. Charles Street right by the hotel for $1.25 a person. There's a $15 a night charge for parking, but if you book the cruise rate, it's free while you're gone. It costs $7 a person to take a taxi from the hotel to the cruise terminal. It was a very clean hotel with a nice staff.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful with marble floors and a historic look. The first thing you notice when you walk into the hotel room is the ceiling--it's at least 15 feet high! The bath is nice with marble floors. I asked for a quiet room and got a corner room partially overlooking the parking lot, which had no street noise. It's every bit as nice as a 4 star hotel--with free breakfast, free happy hour and free wireless internet in the rooms! I booked through the hotel and got a AAA rate of $89! It's 5 blocks from the French Quarter and the streetcar stops right next to the hotel. (You can buy a day pass on board for $5.) The front desk staff--Ayonna especially--were very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location, Value and Service; Spacious, Quiet Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing to be aware of is if you arrive tired and hungry on a Sunday night and don't feel like going to the French Quarter, there are no restaurants that walking distance that are open on Sunday.
reviews.title: Great Location, wonderful taff and very comfortable beds!"

reviews.text: We spent 3 days in New Orleans. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The location is close to food spots , shopping cultural sites. The street car is also right out the side door. It is only 5 blocks fro Bourbon Street- There was a wonderful girl at the front desk-Ayonna. She was so helpful in giving directions to the Musicians Village and how to drive to Algiers. It was nice having the free breakfast and aftyernoon drinks and snacks as well. We sat up on top of the hotel by the pool in the evenings and enjoyed the view.If you have never been to New Orleans you must eat at Acme Oyster House and Gumbo Shop - both were wonderful. In the garden Disstrict the Voodoo BarbQ is also great. Wear comfortable shoes - lots of walking in and out shops ! Great vacation- Thanks Drury !
reviews.title: Great for family with kids and toddlers

reviews.text: I searched countless hours for a hotel to stay at that would be well suited for my family members and kids. Drury Inn was far away from all the choas and noise, but not so bad for walking distance to the French Quarter and very close to the Streetcars. Hotel was clean and spacious. The pool was great for cooling off the kids. Warm breakfast in the AM was awesome and you cannot beat the free drinks and snacks! The fridge and microwave come in handy for leftovers or in our case, we had milk bottles that needed to be kept cold and then warmed for the toddlers. Highly recommended for your NOLA stay. I would book again.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great value for people cruising out of Port of New Orleans

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights room very clean and spacious with a microwave and fridge. Hotel close to everything and the streetcar. Nice rooftop pool and free breakfast. Staff very helpful and friendly
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time to visit New Orleans, had no idea where to stay. Looked on the internet and found the Drury. It was wonderful. The rooms were clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions and information. The hotel was with in walking distance of the French Quarters. They had a very good free breakfast as well as soda and popcorn in the afternoon.
reviews.title: GREAT, GREAT !!!!

reviews.text: Will stay there again next time we are in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay here-will definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this location due to the price and the reviews. We were in town with babies, parents and grandparents and needed a location that worked well for all. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The happy hour was great for all of us to meet and get snacks and drinks before going out to dinner. The breakfast was wonderful! The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The location was excellent, there is a streetcar stop right next to the hotel and we decided to get a $5 pass for one day, which allowed us to go all the way to the garden district and back to canal street and the riverwalk. Kept the grandparents from having to walk too far. It was far enough away from the French Quarter to be family friendly but close enough that we could walk to it with no problem. There is an excellent sushi bar a couple of doors down and a mini mart too. Overall, we were very impressed and will probably stay here again instead of trying to get something in the French Quarter. For the price you can't beat it!
reviews.title: Thumbs up!

reviews.text: Here are the only complaints:
reviews.title: Great Stay At Drury!

reviews.text: I had never stayed at a Drury Inn before but read the reviews. I was pleasantly suprised. The room was basic but good. more than enough room for me and my sister. Parking could get tricky but was fine for me as I have a hanicapped sticker. Beautiful lobby. The location was what I wanted. I did not want to be in a very noisy area. this hotel is right on one of the street car lines and we did hear it a little bit but not annoyingly so. Very convenient to everything. LOved the rooftop pool and hot tub also!!!
reviews.title: Good location and nice hotel
Tattered and Worn Dark Claustrophobic Suite - Not What I Expected
reviews.text: I am a big fan of tripadvisor.com and had few doubts about what i'd get a Drury when I made the reservations. after all....most reviews here have been excellent. i'm not sure if i just got a bad room or what, but i was appauled when i entered the room. the first thing i saw was the totally threadbare and worn couch, chair, chipped up wooden desk. the carpet was old and dark, everything about the room looked ancient. i am not exaggerating when i say the furniture looked like it should have been left at the curb...that is how worn it was. yes, the lobby and hotel were clean, but the room is where i spent my time and i was not comfortable there since it did not feel clean, was so dark, and was so worn out. everything looked this way in my room, and the living area was so very narrow i felt completely closed in. i am wondering if the suites are different than the regular rooms, or if some rooms have updated furniture but i got one that was never updated. i travel to n.o. for work now every month and have been for four months. this is the fourth hotel i've stayed at and i will not stay again. i ended up moving after the first night back to the renaissance....even though there was no free breakfast or happy hour and parking was more, the room was bright, new and didn't make me feel closed in and claustrophobic.

We enjoyed our visit to this Drury Inn. Our room was quite small- more like a room in a European city, but clean and nice. It was not like the photographs on the web site. Think old hotel that has been renovated and you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: good visit

reviews.text: Great hotel, wonderful hospitality, staff funny and very helpful. Rooms nice and clean. Beds comfortable. We were in a suite, the living room was comfy, ample workspace for two people. We were there the week before Mardi Gras on a business trip. Check in evening, our toilet overflows, we use all the towels in the bathroom to mop after we disable the float. Call to front desk. Immediate response. Front desk guy has a plunger and a plastic bag, comes in an plunges the toilet. Clears the paper. Says he's not supposed to plunge toilets. Leaves us with wet towels (and used toilet water) behind the toilet. Fortunately, the room is not level, so all the water stays mostly behind the toilet. Housekeeping gone, so fortunately, we still had two clean towels for a.m. and the detritus is not near our feet. Next day, some towels replaced, and housekeeper leaves cleaning products in bathroom and skimpy on towels. Second day, housekeeper leaves cleaning products in bathroom. Third day I notice that a little piece of plastic wrapping that I had binding some brochures in my suitcase was still laying on the floor in the bedroom. Shower has not great water pressure but is nice and roomy too. Hair dryer was awful. One day we were still in the room when housekeeping came, and when we came back in the early evening our room was not done. A call to front desk and our room was cleaned (with the leftover spray bottle in the bathroom) by time we got back from dinner.
reviews.title: Good value, don't expect too much.

reviews.text: So, it's clean but some staff are a little forgetful. I was not bothered by the issues, it's a quirky little hotel. With a quirky staff...very laid back and quite fun!
reviews.title: Great hotel with great service!

reviews.text: Part way through our recent trip to New Orleans, we cancelled our hotel reservations and transferred our suitcases to the Drury Inn & Suites. Although they were the same price, there was a world of differences!
reviews.title: We liked EVERYTHING about this hotel!

reviews.text: First, the lobby is gorgeous, with plenty of couches, chairs, big-screen TV for the games etc. Right off to the left is the spacious breakfast & evening snack area with tables. The front staff could NOT have been any more accomodating considering we walked in off the street at 12 noon (check in is at 3 pm). They found a room immediately.
reviews.title: Good value, recommended

reviews.text: Our room was lovely - mahogany furniture, tiled bathroom with granite countertop. We had a king room, which was slightly larger than a standard hotel room. There was a desk, comfy chair, cabinet with mini-fridge and microwave, flat screen TV, chest of drawers and 2 bed side tables. The bed was perfect - not too hard and not too soft. Very nice linens, although the bath towels are on the small side.
reviews.title: Mainly Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to get a room with a view (facing the south) so there was plentiful sunshine and a nice view of the business district.
reviews.title: LOVED IT! Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wonderful breakfast buffet had typical cereal, yogurt, donuts, bagels and also hot items: scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast. Then from 3 -10 pm there are free soft drinks and popcorn off the lobby.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Old World Charm Hotel with Big Rooms Good Location
reviews.text: I liked our stay at this hotel. The rooms was large and comfortable. The location was great for walking around. We were able to securely park our car. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our floor was quiet. I would go back for sure.

When I made our first reservation at the Drury Inn in Nov. '08, it was #1 on Tripadvisor. We stayed there one (1) night and liked it so much, we stayed a 2nd night on our return trip home. I am going to combine 2 visits into 1 review.
reviews.title: First visit GREAT/second visit just so-so

reviews.text: RESERVATIONS: Made my first reservation by phone and the young lady who helped us was very sweet, advising me to check the internet 1 month prior to our visit to see if there were any specials being offered. Being that I did not solicit a discount, I was quite surprised that she made this suggestion. I did check back prior to our departure and found the room to be $10 less.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC

reviews.text: We didn't know if we would be spending the night in New Orleans on our return trip. However, we loved the Drury Inn so much, we decided to stay there before catching our flight home. I made the 2nd reservation over the internet. Drury Inn has an esaver rate that is non-refundable, but runs $10 less than a refundable reservation.
reviews.title: Good location, great value, excellent service, clean room, lots of extras!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: The first time we checked in, we were greeted by a very nice young man who was extremely friendly and helpful. He couldn't do enough for us. He explained how breakfast worked, snack time, etc. While some could find his helpfulness a bit overwhelming, we found him quite charming. Check-in was a breeze.
reviews.title: nice hotel with excellant service

aka: Drury Inn And Suites New Orleans
description: Drury Hotel offers its guests a variety of free extras – take, for example, our free hot breakfast. At Drury, “hot” means scrambled eggs, biscuits & gravy, sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. In the evening, join us at our 5:30 Kickback® for free hot food and cold beverages. Our rotating menu features a variety of hot foods, baked potatoes, garden salad, beer, wine, mixed drinks and more! To burn off all of those free extras, Drury has a 24-hour exercise center and a parking lot to jog around. Lastly, Drury’s free wireless Internet and free long distance calls will ensure you can keep tabs on all of your posse back home. A stay in the Big Easy doesn’t get any easier than at the Drury Inn & Suites. Located one block from the famous St. Charles trolley, you have easy access to the regal beauty of Garden District and the vibrant nightlife of the French Quarter.
